name: Arturo Sandoval
description:
'''Arturo Sandoval''' (born November 6, 1949) is a [[Cuban Americans|Cuban-American]] [[jazz]] trumpeter, pianist, timbalero, and composer. While living in his native Cuba, Sandoval was influenced by jazz musicians [[Charlie Parker]], [[Clifford Brown]], and [[Dizzy Gillespie]]. In 1977 he met Gillespie, who became his friend and mentor and helped him [[Defection|defect]] from Cuba while on tour with the United Nation Orchestra. Sandoval became an American [[naturalized citizen]] in 1998. His life was the subject of the film ''[[For Love or Country: The Arturo Sandoval Story]]'' (2000) starring [[Andy Garc√≠a]].

Sandoval, a 2024  Kennedy Center Honors recipient, has won 10 [[Grammy Awards]], [[Billboard Awards|''Billboard'' Awards]] and one [[Emmy Award]]. He has performed at the [[White House]] and at the [[List of Super Bowl halftime shows|Super Bowl]] (1995).
